Content: If the distribution of votes in an assembly does not mirror the
political views of its member polities the assembly seems less
legitimate, and the population of the member polity suffers a happiness
malus. (So a militaristic society may evaluate the number of desired
seats by the fleet contribution, while a socialist one may evaluate
based on population. The militarist one will expect that the seats are
filled by its own faction or militarists, while the communists expect
either its own faction or the communist faction in the seats.) This
should make federations with widley varing views more volatile.
